paratabletxt.paratabletxt: The warning lights and indicators on the instrument cluster, center panel and outside rear view mirrors inform the driver of the status of the vehicle’s various systems.

title.title: Warning lights and indicators displayed on the instrument cluster

p.p: For the purpose of explanation, the following illustrations display all warning lights and indicators illuminated.

title.title: Multi-information display (7-inch display [when analog speedometer is displayed])
Multi-information display (7-inch display [when digital speedometer is displayed])

p.p: Warning lights inform the driver of malfunctions in the indicated vehicle’s systems.
(Red)
(Yellow)
(Red)
(Yellow)
(Yellow)
(Flashes)
(Flashes)
(Orange)
(Flashes)
(Flashes)
(Flashes or illuminates)
(Yellow)
(Flashes)
(Flashes)

These lights come on when the engine switch is turned to ON to indicate that a system check is being performed. They will turn off after the engine is started, or after a few seconds. There may be a malfunction in a system if the lights do not come on, or turn off. Have the vehicle inspected by your Toyota dealer.

title.title: If a safety system warning light does not come on

p.p: Should a safety system light such as the ABS and SRS warning light not come on when you start the engine, this could mean that these systems are not available to help protect you in an accident, which could result in death or serious injury. Have the vehicle inspected by your Toyota dealer immediately if this occurs.
The indicators inform the driver of the operating state of the vehicle’s various systems.
(Flashes)
(Green)

These lights come on when the engine switch is turned to ON to indicate that a system check is being performed. They will turn off after the engine is started, or after a few seconds. There may be a malfunction in a system if the lights do not come on, or turn off. Have the vehicle inspected by your Toyota dealer.
This light comes on when the system is turned off.
Depending on the operating condition, the color and illuminating/flashing state of the light change.
Vehicles without RCTA function:

p_sub.p_sub: In order to confirm operation, the BSM outside rear view mirror indicators illuminate in the following situations:

itemtxt.itemtxt: If the system is functioning correctly, the BSM outside rear view mirror indicators will turn off after a few seconds.
If the BSM outside rear view mirror indicators do not illuminate or do not turn off, there may be a malfunction in the system.
If this occurs, have the vehicle inspected by by your Toyota dealer.

p.p: Vehicles with RCTA function:

p_sub.p_sub: These lights come on when the engine switch is turned to ON to indicate that a system check is being performed. They will turn off after the engine is started, or after a few seconds. There may be a malfunction in a system if the lights do not come on, or turn off. Have the vehicle inspected by your Toyota dealer.

p.p: This light illuminates on the outside rear view mirrors.
Vehicles with a multi-information display: This light illuminates on the multi-information display.
When the outside temperature is approximately 3°C (37°F) or lower, this indicator will flash for approximately 10 seconds, then stay on.
This light illuminates on the center panel.

callouttxt_sub.callouttxt_sub: Displays the engine speed in revolutions per minute
Displays the outside temperature within the range of -40°C (-40°F) to 50°C (122°F)
Displays the engine coolant temperature
Changes the item displayed on the drive monitor display.
The “DISP” switch on the steering wheel can also be used to change the item displayed on the drive monitor display.
Displays the quantity of fuel remaining in the tank

itemtxt.itemtxt: In the following situations, the correct outside temperature may not be displayed, or the display may take longer than normal to change:
When stopped, or driving at low speeds (less than 25 km/h [16 mph])
When the outside temperature has changed suddenly (at the entrance/exit of a garage, tunnel, etc.)
When “--” or “E” is displayed, the system may be malfunctioning. Take your vehicle to your Toyota dealer.

title.title: The information display at low temperatures

p.p: Allow the interior of the vehicle to warm up before using the liquid crystal information display. At extremely low temperatures, the information display monitor may respond slowly, and display changes may be delayed.

For example, there is a lag between the driver’s shifting and the new gear number appearing on the display. This lag could cause the driver to downshift again, causing rapid and excessive engine braking and possibly an accident resulting in death or injury.

title.title: To prevent damage to the engine and its components

itemtxt.itemtxt: Do not let the indicator needle of the tachometer enter the red zone, which indicates the maximum engine speed.

p.p: Use the clock adjustment buttons to adjust the clock.

itemtxt.itemtxt: Press the “+” button to adjust the displayed time forward.
Press the “-” button to adjust the displayed time backward.

callouttxt_sub.callouttxt_sub: Displays the engine speed in revolutions per minute
Displays the outside temperature within the range of -40°C (-40°F) to 50°C (122°F)
Displays the quantity of fuel remaining in the tank
Displays the engine coolant temperature

itemtxt.itemtxt: In the following situations, the correct outside temperature may not be displayed, or the display may take longer than normal to change:

p.p: Allow the interior of the vehicle to warm up before using the liquid crystal information display. At extremely low temperatures, the information display monitor may respond slowly, and display changes may be delayed.

For example, there is a lag between the driver’s shifting and the new gear number appearing on the display. This lag could cause the driver to downshift again, causing rapid and excessive engine braking and possibly an accident resulting in death or injury.

itemtxt.itemtxt: Do not let the indicator needle of the tachometer enter the red zone, which indicates the maximum engine speed.

indexmarker.marker: Odometer and trip meter display:Display change button

p.p: Press the display change button until the desired item is displayed.

indexmarker.marker: Odometer and trip meter display:Display items

itemtxt_sub.itemtxt_sub: Displays the total distance the vehicle has been driven.
Displays the distance the vehicle has been driven since the meter was last reset. Trip meters A and B can be used to record and display different distances independently.
To reset, display the desired trip meter and press and hold the display change button.
Displays the meter light control display.

itemtxt.itemtxt: The brightness of the meter can be adjusted separately for when the tail lights are on and off.
To adjust the brightness, display the meter light control display and press and hold the display change button.

p.p: The following can be changed:
The clocks on the following can be adjusted on the audio system screen.

title.title: Setting the clock to be adjusted automatically by GPS

steptxt.steptxt: Select “Auto adjust by GPS” to set to on.
Select “Auto adjust by GPS” to set to off.

itemtxt.itemtxt: Hour: Select “-” or “+” of “Hours” to adjust the hour.
Minute: Select “-” or “+” of “Minutes” to adjust the minute.
“:00”: Select to set the clock to the beginning of the nearest hour.

itemtxt_sub.itemtxt_sub: e.g.

p.p: Select the desired time zone.

steptxt.steptxt: Select “24-Hour time format” and then on/off.

p_sub.p_sub: When set to off, the clock is displayed in 12 hour time format.

title.title: Clock settings screen (vehicles with navigation/multimedia system)

title.title: Clock settings screen (vehicles with navigation/multimedia system)

p.p: If equipped
A variety of driving-related information can be displayed. Vehicle settings can also be changed.
Small spots or light spots may appear on the display. This phenomenon is characteristic of liquid crystal displays, and there is no problem continuing to use the display.

itemtxt.itemtxt: When operating the drive monitor display while driving, pay extra attention to the safety of the area around the vehicle.
Do not look continuously at the drive monitor display while driving as you may fail to see pedestrians, objects on the road, etc. ahead of the vehicle.

title.title: The information display at low temperatures

p.p: To change the displayed item, press the display change button or the “DISP” switch.

p_sub.p_sub: Each time the button/switch is pressed, the displayed item will be changed.

itemtxt_sub.itemtxt_sub: “ODO” will be displayed.
Displays the total distance the vehicle has been driven.
“TRIP A”/“TRIP B” will be displayed.
Displays the distance the vehicle has been driven since the meter was last reset. Trip meters A and B can be used to record and display different distances independently.
To reset, display the desired trip meter and press and hold the display change button or the “DISP” switch.
Displays instantaneous current fuel consumption.
“AVG.” will be displayed.
Displays the average fuel consumption since the function was reset.
To reset, display the average fuel consumption and press and hold the display change button or the “DISP” switch.
“RANGE” will be displayed.
Displays driving range with remaining fuel.
This distance is computed based on your average fuel consumption. As a result, the actual distance that can be driven may differ from that displayed.
Displays the average vehicle speed since engine start.
Displays the meter light control display.

itemtxt.itemtxt: The brightness of the meter can be adjusted separately for when the tail lights are on and off.
To adjust the brightness, display the meter light control display and press and hold the display change button or the “DISP” switch.

callouttxt_sub.callouttxt_sub: During Eco-friendly acceleration (Eco driving), the Eco Driving Indicator Light will turn on. When the acceleration exceeds the Zone of Eco driving, or when the vehicle is stopped, the light turns off.
Suggests the Zone of Eco driving with current Eco driving ratio based on acceleration.
If the acceleration exceeds the Zone of Eco driving, the right side of the Eco Driving Indicator Zone Display will blink.
At this time, the Eco Driving Indicator Light will turn off.

p.p: Eco Driving Indicator will not operate under the following conditions:

itemtxt.itemtxt: The shift lever is in any position other than D.
The driving mode is set to sport mode. (if equipped)
The vehicle speed is approximately 130 km/h (80 mph) or higher.

title.title: Meter display settings that can be changed

itemtxt_sub.itemtxt_sub: Select to enable/disable the Eco Driving Indicator Light.

steptxt.steptxt: To change to the customizing mode screen, display the odometer and then press and hold the display change button or the “DISP” switch.
Press the display change button or the “DISP” switch to change the displayed item.

steptxt_sub.steptxt_sub: Each time the switch is pressed, the displayed item will be changed.

steptxt.steptxt: Press and hold the display change button or the “DISP” switch to change the setting of the item.

steptxt_sub.steptxt_sub: Each time the switch is pressed and held, the setting will be changed.

title.title: Cautions during setting up the display

p.p: If the engine is running when changing the display settings, ensure that the vehicle is parked in a place with adequate ventilation. In a closed area such as a garage, exhaust gases including harmful carbon monoxide (CO) may collect and enter the vehicle. This may lead to death or a serious health hazard.
To prevent battery discharge, ensure that the engine is running while setting up the display features.
If equipped

itemtxt.itemtxt: LDA (Lane Departure Alert with steering control) (if equipped)
Dynamic radar cruise control full-speed range (if equipped)

callouttxt_sub.callouttxt_sub: By selecting menu icons on the multi-information display, a variety of driving-related information can be displayed. The multi-information display can also be used to change display settings and other vehicle settings.
Warning or advice pop-up displays are also displayed in certain situations.

itemtxt.itemtxt: LDA (Lane Departure Alert with steering control) (if equipped)
Dynamic radar cruise control full-speed range (if equipped)

callouttxt_sub.callouttxt_sub: By selecting menu icons on the multi-information display, a variety of driving-related information can be displayed. The multi-information display can also be used to change display settings and other vehicle settings.
Warning or advice pop-up displays are also displayed in certain situations.

p.p: Small spots or light spots may appear on the display. This phenomenon is characteristic of liquid crystal displays, and there is no problem continuing to use the display.

itemtxt.itemtxt: When operating the multi-information display while driving, pay extra attention to the safety of the area around the vehicle.
Do not look continuously at the multi-information display while driving as you may fail to see pedestrians, objects on the road, etc. ahead of the vehicle.

title.title: The information display at low temperatures

p.p: The multi-information display is operated using the meter control switches.

callouttxt_sub.callouttxt_sub: Linked with the hands-free system, sending or receiving call is displayed. For details regarding the hands-free system, refer to the “Navigation and Multimedia System Owner’s Manual”.

itemtxt_sub.itemtxt_sub: Displays driving range with remaining fuel. Use the displayed values as a reference only.
This distance is computed based on your average fuel consumption. As a result, the actual distance that can be driven may differ from that displayed.

Displays driving range with remaining fuel.
This distance is computed based on your average fuel consumption. As a result, the actual distance that can be driven may differ from that displayed.

itemtxt_sub.itemtxt_sub: Displays the average fuel consumption since engine start.
Displays the average fuel consumption since the vehicle was refueled.

callouttxt_sub.callouttxt_sub: During Eco-friendly acceleration (Eco driving), the Eco Driving Indicator Light will turn on. When the acceleration exceeds the Zone of Eco driving, or when the vehicle is stopped, the light turns off.
Suggests the Zone of Eco driving with current Eco driving ratio based on acceleration.
If the acceleration exceeds the Zone of Eco driving, the right side of the Eco Driving Indicator Zone Display will illuminate.
At this time, the Eco Driving Indicator Light will turn off.

This distance is computed based on your average fuel consumption. As a result, the actual distance that can be driven may differ from that displayed.

p.p: Eco Driving Indicator will not operate under the following conditions:

itemtxt.itemtxt: The shift lever is in any position other than D.
The driving mode is set to sport mode. (if equipped)
The vehicle speed is approximately 130 km/h (80 mph) or higher.

indexmarker.marker: Multi-information display:Driving support system information display

p.p: Select to display the operational status of the following systems:
Select to display the following navigation system-linked information:
Select to enable selection of an audio source or track on the meter using the meter control switches.

p_sub.p_sub: Displays drive information such as the following:

itemtxt.itemtxt: Distance: Displays the distance driven since engine start
Elapsed time: Displays the elapsed time since engine start
Average vehicle speed: Displays the average vehicle speed since engine start

title.title: Meter display settings that can be changed

itemtxt_sub.itemtxt_sub: Select to change the language displayed.
Select to change the units of measure displayed.
Select to set the display of the speedometer to analog/digital.
Select to enable/disable the Eco Driving Indicator Light.
Select to display/not display the audio system linked display.
Select to change the displayed content of the following:
Select to change the drive information type display between after start/after reset.
Select to set the first and second items of the drive information display to any of the following: average vehicle speed/distance/elapsed time.
Select to enable/disable pop-up displays for each relevant system.
Select to turn the multi-information display off.
Select to reset the meter display settings to the default setting.

title.title: Vehicle functions and settings that can be changed

itemtxt.itemtxt: Some settings cannot be changed while driving. When changing settings, park the vehicle in a safe place.
If a warning message is displayed, operation of the settings display will be suspended.

title.title: Cautions during setting up the display

p.p: If the engine is running when changing the display settings, ensure that the vehicle is parked in a place with adequate ventilation. In a closed area such as a garage, exhaust gases including harmful carbon monoxide (CO) may collect and enter the vehicle. This may lead to death or a serious health hazard.
To prevent battery discharge, ensure that the engine is running while setting up the display features.
If equipped

paratabletxt.paratabletxt: The head-up display projects a variety of driving-related information and the operating state of the driving support systems on the windshield.

p.p: Illustrations used in this text are intended as examples, and may differ from the image that is actually displayed by the head-up display.
The engine switch is in ON.
The head-up display may seem dark or hard to see when viewed through sunglasses, especially polarized sunglasses. Adjust the brightness of the head-up display or remove your sunglasses.

title.title: Street name display (vehicles with navigation system)

p.p: Only street names which are included in the map data will be displayed.

itemtxt.itemtxt: Check that the position and brightness of the head-up display image does not interfere with safe driving. Incorrect adjustment of the image’s position or brightness may obstruct the driver’s view and lead to an accident, resulting in death or serious injury.
Do not continuously look at the head-up display while driving as you may fail to see pedestrians, objects on the road, etc. ahead of the vehicle.
Do not place any drinks near the head-up display projector. If the projector gets wet, electrical malfunctions may result.
Brightness and vertical position of the head-up display

itemtxt_sub.itemtxt_sub: Select to adjust the brightness or vertical position of the head-up display.

itemtxt.itemtxt: Select to change the display between the following:
Select to enable/disable the following items:

itemtxt_sub.itemtxt_sub: Select to adjust the angle of the head-up display.

p.p: If the head-up display is disabled, it will remain disabled when the engine switch is turned off then back to ON.

title.title: Caution for changing settings of the head-up display

p.p: If the engine is running when changing the display settings,  ensure that the vehicle is parked in a place with adequate ventilation. In a closed area such as a garage, exhaust gases including harmful carbon monoxide (CO) may collect and enter the vehicle. This may lead to death or a serious health hazard.

title.title: When changing the settings of the head-up display

p.p: To prevent battery discharge, ensure that the engine is running while changing the settings of the head-up display.

indexmarker.marker: Head-up display:Driving support system display area

p.p: Displays the operational status of the following systems:

p_sub.p_sub: Details of content displayed on the head-up display may differ from that displayed on the multi-information display. For details, refer to the explanation of each system.

p.p: Displays the following items which are linked to the navigation system:
Pop-up displays for the following systems will be displayed when necessary:
Displays a warning/suggestion/advice message or the operating state of a relevant system.

p_sub.p_sub: Details of content displayed on the head-up display may differ from that displayed on the multi-information display. For details, refer to the explanation of each system.

p.p: Some warning messages are displayed when necessary, according to certain conditions.

p_sub.p_sub: Details of content displayed on the head-up display may differ from that displayed on the multi-information display.

p.p: Displayed when an audio remote control switch on the steering wheel is operated.
Displayed when the hands-free system is operated.

title.title: When a pop-up display is displayed

p.p: When a pop-up display is displayed, a current display may no longer be displayed. In this case, the display will return after the pop-up display disappears.
Displays the engine speed in revolutions per minute.
Displayed when the engine switch is turned to ON or when the low outside temperature indicator is flashing.

itemtxt.itemtxt: When the ambient temperature is approximately 3°C (37°F) or lower, the low outside temperature indicator will flash for approximately 10 seconds and the outside temperature display will turn off. In this case, the display will be displayed again when the outside temperature becomes approximately 5°C (41°F) or higher.
In the following situations, the correct outside temperature may not be displayed, or the display may take longer than normal to change:
When stopped, or driving at low speeds (less than 25 km/h [16 mph])
When the outside temperature has changed suddenly (at the entrance/exit of a garage, tunnel, etc.)
When “--” or “E” is displayed, the system may be malfunctioning. Take your vehicle to your Toyota dealer.

p.p: If equipped

paratabletxt.paratabletxt: Fuel consumption information can be displayed on the audio system screen.

steptxt_sub.steptxt_sub: If a screen other than “Trip information” is displayed, select “Trip information”.

p.p: Average fuel consumption for the past 15 minutes is divided by color into past averages and averages attained since the engine switch was last turned to ON. Use the displayed average fuel consumption as a reference.

p_sub.p_sub: The image is an example only, and may vary slightly from actual conditions.

steptxt_sub.steptxt_sub: If a screen other than “History” is displayed, select “History”.

p.p: The average fuel consumption history is divided by color into past averages and the average fuel consumption since the last updated. Use the displayed average fuel consumption as a reference.

p_sub.p_sub: The image is an example only, and may vary slightly from actual conditions.

p.p: Update the latest fuel consumption by selecting “Clip” to measure the current fuel consumption again.
The fuel consumption data can be deleted by selecting “Clear”.
Displays the estimated maximum distance that can be driven with the quantity of fuel remaining.
